Ivy Park is a boutique condominium with a unique attention to detail and finishes. Apartment 2C is a finely crafted corner two-bedroom, two-bathroom unit, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows facing North and West, an open and windowed kitchen with breakfast bar, a massive private terrace, and an in unit washer/dryer. The carefully curated package of finishes include: a Viking appliance package, Italian Garofolio Avio doors, Snaidero cabinets, Hansgrophe fixtures, and kitchen counters with Concrete style Ceaserstone countertops. Additionally, 2C comes with a wine refrigerator and an oven hood that vents out. The building amenities include a residents' rooftop lounge, fitness center, bicycle storage, and a 1,000 square foot entry courtyard. Four parks surround Ivy Park, and the building has convenient access to multiple train lines, Whole Foods, and more. Listing images are renderings of the unit not actual photos.

Located across from the New East River Plaza with Costco, Target, Old Navy, Marshalls and a host of other stores. Built in 1998, The Helux is one of the original pioneers of luxury living in Hell's Kitchen's far-west side. From our 24-hour concierge to our range of amenity spaces and finely-appointment units, our community offers a lifestyle that savvy New Yorkers have come to expect.

- Northwest exposure with sweeping city and Hudson views!
- Separate, windowed kitchen with stainless steel appliances.
- Updated bathroom with chrome fixtures.
- 3 large closets.
- Building amenities include 24-hour concierge, fitness room, bike room, storage cages, sun deck, children's playroom, and garage parking.

The neighborhood is our unspoken amenity. We are located a short walk from the A/C/E trains at W 42nd Street. 1 block south of the tony eats at Gotham West Market, a block and a half from Pier 84 at Hudson River Park, and a 10-minute walk from the Javits Convention Center.

The Helux has something to offer everyone stop by and see why we might be the perfect fit.

Unique loft building in the heart of trendy Bushwick. The Loom Building is surrounded by a variety of charming restaurants, bars and cafes. Located less than 15 minutes to Union Square via the L train. JMZ trains are located close by. The ground floor of this building contains several small store fronts including a yoga studio and large cafe.

Don't miss this recently renovated 4 bedroom 4.5 bath in the landmarked Manhattan House. The gracious foyer and expansive great room are perfect for entertaining. The eat in kitchen is filled with top of the line Viking stainless steel appliances and there are 2 large terraces, one off the kitchen and the other off the den. There are 4 large en suite bedrooms including a master suite, 4 full bathrooms and 1 half bath. The apartment was recently renovated and features hard wood floors throughout. The building was designated a New York City Landmark in 2007 and was gut renovated to bring it up to date. Amenities include a 24 hour doorman, full-time residence manager, on-site valet parking, Rooftop Manhattan Club, spa & fitness center, yoga studio, children's playroom and bicycle storage.

This extra spacious, double height ceiling duplex loft with small patio has approximately 1500 square feet and can be configured in a number of ways with plenty of creative space to suit your needs. The upper level houses the dining area, kitchen, master bedroom and large full bath with access to a small outdoor area. The expansive and bright master bedroom features an on-suite bathroom, walk-in closet and decorative fireplace and direct access to the outdoor space. Downstairs, are the living room, extra room/office/den/rec space, second bathroom with standing shower and large, separate, laundry room where you can also store bikes and large items. This quasi industrial and funky loft space is unique and offers so many options! It really is a must see! Close to Prospect Park and Th F/G R trains, restaurants and cafes. Immediate occupancy.

Introducing 336 Flatbush Ave- Park Slopes Finest Rental Masterpiece! A collection of 8 rental apartments in a gut renovated, pre-war building on the corner of Flatbush Ave and Sterling Place, just steps away from Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza. With a common roof deck sporting spectacular views, bike and stroller storage, this building was carefully crafted to suit the needs of every city dweller. Each renovated apartment is a well-proportioned 2-bedroom, 2-bath residence, framed by open-style dining and living space. 7 foot high windows facing north and south, will illuminate your apartment and amplify your living experience. The unit is fully equipped with stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, energy efficient heating and cooling system, white oak hardwood floors, and washer/dryer. 2B boasts a PRIVATE roof deck, easily accessed from the living room. A fabulous place to drink your morning coffee and read the paper. Conveniently located in the heart of the North Slope, 336 Flatbush is adjacent to Park Slopes first Soul Cycle and the brand new Union Market. Just a few short blocks to Prospect Park, Grand Army Plaza, The Brooklyn Public Library, Prospect Park Farmers Market, Barclays Center, and summer concerts at Celebrate Brooklyn! The opportunities are endless in this location! Nearby Transportation includes the B, Q train on 7th Avenue. 2, 3 trains at Grand Army Plaza, and just a short walk to Atlantic Terminal where you can locate the N, R, B, Q, 2, 3, 4, 5, and the LIRR.

Graced with an array of sleek fixtures and finishes, this luminous 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom home is a paradigm of contemporary Brooklyn living. Features of the apartment include gorgeous porcelain tile flooring, northern exposure, a Daikin heating and cooling system, a convenient in-unit Samsung washer/dryer, floor-to-ceiling sound-proof casement windows from All Seasons, and a charming balcony.

 Beyond a functional entryway space, the home flows into an open-concept living room, dining room, and kitchen saturated with natural light. The living area leads out onto the balcony, while the kitchen is equipped with an eat-in peninsula, sleek white quartz countertops, a mosaic tile backsplash, white lacquer cabinetry, and a suite of high-end stainless steel appliances from Samsung. The bedroom possesses a large reach-in closet and has easy access to a pristine full bathroom with porcelain floors, heated flooring system, and chic Fresca and Moen fixtures.

 710 Grand is a stunning boutique condominium situated in the heart of East Williamsburg. The building is surrounded by a multitude of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops, most of which can be found along Grand and Lorimer Streets as well as Graham and Bushwick Avenues. It is close to several playgrounds and parks, and is less than three blocks from the L subway line. Amenities include a bright, inviting lobby, private 70 sq. ft. storage units, a large elevator, a [video intercom system], and a common rooftop deck with glass railing, lounge furniture, an integrated grill and outdoor refrigerator, and breathtaking views of Brooklyn and the Manhattan skyline. Pets are welcome.

Neighborhood

Take a stroll through the West Village and fall in love with its charm. Enjoy the many boutiques and trendy cafes hidden in pockets across the neighborhood. The neighborhood is tucked between Greenwich Village and the Hudson River and is one of the quietest and most sophisticated pockets of Downtown Manhattan. Primarily residential with a distinct lack of commercial buildings, the leafy, off-the-grid streets are peaceful during the day, but get livelier at night. Find your self in one of many low-lit cocktail bars that have become a staple in West Village.

Fitness Center:
- Equinox Greenwich Avenue
- Gotham Gym
- Refine Method West Village

Grocery:
- Gourmet Garage
- D'Agostino
- LifeThyme Natural Market

Schedule a private tour with Mark or Robert from Real NY Properties!

***THE BEST DEAL IN WEST VILLAGE***

Meticulously renovated NoMad Pre-War loft. (2) Bedrooms (2) Bathrooms With a Home Office. Designed with an storage as a primary component, this loft delivers volume with its high ceilings and open floor plan. The foyer includes 2 closets and leads to an expansive living/dining room with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves. The stunning chef's kitchen features cherry cabinetry, Franke double sinks, counter dining, bar area with built-in wine cooler and stainless steel appliances. The master suite has a king-size bed, large walk-in plus 3 additional closets and serene bath with glass enclosed shower. The second bedroom accommodates bunk beds and features rich walnut custom closet. Guest room/office has a double-size closet. There is a second full bath. Rising tall above Manhattans East Side, Kips Bay Court offers studio, 1, 2, 3, and 4-bedroom apartments perfectly situated for convenient living. Anytime day or night, this eight-building, pet-friendly, and 24/7 concierge-attended community has you covered.

With just six residences per floor, Kips Bay Court offers some of the most spacious apartments to rent in the city. Jumpstart your morning with coffee and enjoy the inspiring view from your homes balcony (or in cooler months, through the oversized windows) that overlook the Midtown skyline and East River. Those who love dining at home will appreciate the ample quartz or granite countertop space, stainless steel GE appliances, and brush nickel fixtures and finishes. Many units even offer open layouts perfect for entertaining. After guests leave, let the dishwasher do the work, while you kick back in spa-style bathroom(s) complete with Koehler finishes, glass-enclosed showers, and oversized medicine cabinets with storage. With a range of finishes, unit sizes, and layouts, Kips Bay Court is sure to have something fit for everyone.

Beyond our doors, our neighborhood has it all from groceries at Trader Joes and Fairway to local staples including the incredible Mercer Street Market to unique finds like Tipsy Scoop and the AMC movie theater (complete with IMAX and reserved seating.) Target is coming soon to the base of the building in early 2019.Commuting and getting around New York City is a cinch with the 6 train down the block at 28th Street, multiple bus lines outside your door, and even quick access to the East River Ferry at 34th Street.

A former chocolate factory turned authentic loft community, The Chocolate Factory Lofts boasts expansive, unique layouts, contemporary finishes and rustic industrial charm. Modern finishes blend seamlessly with original factory fixtures such as hardwood flooring, exposed brick walls, reclaimed wood beams and soaring 12' ceilings. In addition, the building also features a stunning roof deck with Manhattan skyline views, a landscaped courtyard, part-time doorman, on-site laundry and garage parking. Located in the historic and artistic Wallabout District of Clinton Hill between Williamsburg and Dumbo, one of Brooklyn's most alluring neighborhoods and just a block from the Brooklyn Navy Yard, The Chocolate Factory boasts retail and business space on site and is surrounded by renowned restaurants, trendy cafes, gourmet grocers and hip boutiques. Transportation options include the Clinton/Washington G train, multiple bus lines to the A,C,F,B and Q trains and a Citi Bike station just outside of the front door. Call today to see these amazing lofts!

The Copley Condominium is a highly regarded, architecturally distinguished, full service building with exceptional amenities. It opened in 1987 with 162 residences on 28 stories. The marble entrance lobby is elegant but not imposing. The quarter acre landscaped garden provides a retreat from busy city life. The health club has three levels with exercise equipment, a 40 ft pool, whirlpool, sauna and aerobics room, and offers complimentary exercise classes. The club is light and airy with walls of windows overlooking the garden and tree-lined streets. There are indoor and outdoor play areas. The laundry room next to the playroom has big South windows. The garden, health club, laundry room and play areas are accessed from the second floor. Each apartment comes with a private basement storage room according to its size. 

MOST SOUGHT AFTER LINCOLN CENTER LOCATION 
The Copley is located steps from Lincoln Center which houses the world-class Met Opera, the NY Philharmonic, the NYC Ballet and the American Ballet, two theaters, the Juilliard School and the New York Film Festival. Jazz at Lincoln Center plays here and the Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle. A ten-screen movie theater and the Reebok Sports Club are in the next block. Many fine restaurants and stores, including excellent food stores, are nearby. Some of New York's finest museums can be reached on foot from here. Fordham University and the NY Institute of Technology are a few blocks away, and Columbia University is reached easily by subway. Commuting by bus or subway to offices in midtown and in the financial center is quick and efficient. For outdoor activities, Central Park and Riverside Park are only minutes away. Bus and subway stops are nearby.

The Azure at 436 Albee Square is Downtown Brooklyns newest luxury apartment building. Designed by Eran Chens increasingly prolific ODA Architecture, this blue glass tower rises high above the downtowns ever expanding skyline. Once inside you are greeted by vaulted ceilings and striking green mosaic tiling throughout the elevator attended lobby. At 28 stories tall, the building boasts 150 beautifully appointed apartments starting on the 3rd floor sitting over two floors of bustling retail. Apartment layouts range from Studios to 3 bedrooms, each with unique outdoor spaces. Travel further to the roof and find 360-degree views of downtown Manhattan, Brooklyn, the West Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

 Unit Description

 Each living space serves as your cozy urban sanctuary. With a minimalist, modern style, featuring sleek white counters with an abundance of storage and state of the art stainless steel appliances, these units make a night at home a retreat from the fast pace of the city. Wall to wall white oak floors are laid throughout your home, and floor to ceiling windows offer stunning views. As you relax at home, enjoy the luxury of listening to your favorite music through built-in bluetooth speakers. Each suite also offers the convenience of an in-unit washer and dryer, so you can go enjoy a beverage on your private terrace while youre waiting for your clothes to dry.

 Views

 Wake up every morning to a beautiful sunrise pouring over Downtown Brooklyn, high above the hustle and bustle of the city. After a long day at work, wind down with a cocktail on your spacious balcony as the day fades over the horizon. Feeling social? Take a trip up to the rooftop terrace where youll find spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Promenade, Barclays Center, Downtown Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg Bridges, and the Manhattan skyline. No matter the time of day, these views will never fail to impress or inspire.

 Area/Trains

 Nestled in the heart of Downtown Brooklyn, The Azure is steps away from everything the area has to offer. Across the street from Alamo Draft House, Trader Joes and DeKalb Market Hall, you dont need to go far from home for the things you need. Walk to catch a concert or a Nets game only minutes away at the world famous Barclays center. Take a scenic 10-minute bike ride down to Park Slope or a quick stroll over to Brooklyn Bridge Park. If youre feeling adventurous and ready to explore, The Azure is surrounded by multiple subway lines ready to transport you to the best neighborhoods the city has to offer.

 Lifestyle

 The Azure offers not just a place to call home but a lifestyle, and as time becomes more limited, convenience is key. Keep your heart rate up by spending time in the ten thousand square foot gym, complete with personal trainers and a discounted tenant membership. After you break a sweat, stop by the package room to pick up your parcels, followed by your delivered groceries waiting for you in the cold storage room. Grab your bike from the bike room and head over to Devocion coffee shop for some of the best coffee in the world. While theres plenty to do around the Azure, you also have the opportunity to converse with your neighbors on the outdoor terrace or in the 3rd-floor tenants lounge, where you can find a wet bar, game room, and business center. Afterwards, you can catch a movie in The Azures state-of-the-art outdoor amphitheater.

Plaza Penthouse -Terraced Duplex

NEW PRICE. A rare opportunity to rent a coveted Duplex Penthouse with 400 sq ft of terrace space and two  wood burning fireplaces at the iconic Plaza Private Residences. Sun flooded with natural light, this unparalleled 2900 sq ft 3 Bedroom 5 Bath home is both unique and impressive in every way. The expansive Living room features a dramatic wall of glass skylight windows with captivating, unobstructed views of the Grand Army Plaza and Fifth Avenue. The 21st floor features a luxurious Master Bedroom Suite with wood burning  fireplace, terrace and dressing room with multiple fitted closets. The terrace is accessed from the 21st floor landing and both bedrooms. This quintessential residence features herringbone solid oak floors, surrounded by an inlaid border, custom built-ins. The Kitchen has Plaza collection appliances by Viking and Miele with glass-fronted custom cabinets. The striking nero marquina stone countertops compliment the white mosaic calacutta marble tile back splashes. The Bathroom floor design is derived from the original mosaic patterns found in the historic Plaza lobbies, while the classically inspired limited-edition fixtures and fittings with "Double P" insignias were crafted by Lefroy Brooks and Kohler. 

Built in 1907 by Henry J. Hardenberg in the style of a French Renaissance Chateau, The Plaza is a National Historic Landmark. Once home to the Vanderbilts and Astors, it continues its reign among the most prestigious addresses in the world. Although The Plaza Private Residences are separated from The Plaza Hotel for your privacy with a Landmark Private Residential Lobby, this white-glove Condominium offers residences full Hotel Services, Luxury Attache Concierge Service, and amenities including The Oak Room and Oak Bar, Palm Court, Grand Ballroom, Champagne Bar, Rose Club Plaza Food Hall by Todd English, La Palestra fitness center, Guerlain Spa and Warren Tricomi Hair Salon.

A magnificent, over-sized One Bedroom residence is for rent in a building with unparalleled service and amenities. Featuring a massive master bedroom suite with a five fixture, spa-like bathroom and a generous walk-in closet, this fully furnished apartment is a perfect sanctuary in the center of the financial world. It further boasts a row of massive windows, high ceilings, an integrated kitchen, central AC, a washer & dryer, a powder room and recessed lighting. 

55 Wall Street, a classic Beaux Arts masterpiece, was originally constructed in 1830 by the architect Isaiah Rogers and expanded by architects McKim, Meade & White, and over its lifetime of near 200 years, it served as the NY Merchants Exchange, NYSE, US Customs House and National City Bank Headquarters before it was converted into Cipriani Residences in 2006. Offering the highest level of service, the amenities include concierge service, doorman, library, roof deck, conference room and courtyard. With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

Clinton is trendy among those looking for a diverse place that still captures the history of New York. Now a haven for young professionals, actors, and writers, particularly ones who work in the Theater district, and is known for an high concentration of excellent and diverse restaurants, as well as some of the best bars and night spots in Manhattan. Clinton witnessed a construction boom over the past decade and because of that, there are many high-end luxury buildings and businesses that cater to those with exquisite taste. Separated from the Theater District by quiet, tree-lined streets, on street parking and much to do for locals, the Hell's Kitchen/Clinton area is very unique. Where neighbors wave to neighbors and friendly local acquaintances nod and say hello, you'll feel very much at home here.Virtually every subway line in the city runs through the station at Times Square. Clinton residents are truly an eclectic mix of middle income and upper-class New Yorkers

This 3 bedroom (convertible 4 bedroom) triplex PENTHOUSE is comprised of over 7,200 square feet complemented by two private outdoor terraces. The center focal point, a Portero marble wood-burning fireplace (one of four located throughout the home) is flanked by (beautiful)walls paneled in quarter sawn limed oak and illuminated by enormous skylights above that run the entire 38-foot-wide expanse; wenge floors and exposed steel and stone create an ambience that is both monumental and warm. The top of the line kitchen flows seamlessly from the living room and features Bulthaup cabinetry, double ovens, Subzero refrigerator and a 400 bottle walk in wine cellar. Elegance, History and 21st Century Convenience in the Heart of Harlem
Fully-Renovated Townhouse with 5 Bedrooms, 3 Full-Baths and 2 Half-Baths

Steps from main thoroughfares, transportation, and Harlem hotspots, sits this landmark single-family townhouse. Built in the late 1880s by distinguished architect Francis Kimball, and then totally renovated and restored by David Mann, 133 West 122nd Street is exceptionally chic and fits any lifestyle.

Boasting seven decorative fireplaces, gorgeous parquet floors, impeccable millwork and moldings, and treasures such as stained glass transoms and pocket doors with inlaid windows, the townhouse contains everything one desires in a historic home. Additionally, all five stories celebrate modern clean lines by incorporating customized shelving, sleek tiles and countertops, and vertical accents that highlight soaring ceilings. With four bedrooms, three full and two half-baths, formal entertaining spaces, a state-of-the-art kitchen, and private garden, this rental opportunity should not be missed.

Garden Floor:
An entrance under the stoop leads to an enclosed hallway that serves as a mudroom with organized hooks and benches for transitioning out of the hustle and bustle of the city. The garden level is primed for entertaining. A formal dining room is situated at the front of the floor. It features a corner fireplace, original wainscoting, and an impressive built-in sideboard.

The garden rear contains a modern, country-style kitchen with 17-foot granite island, farmhouse-style sink, and top-of-the-line appliances including a six burner JennAir gas stove, two SubZero refrigerators, and Miele dishwasher. There is also a large pantry, open hearth, and bay window. A powder room completes the floor.

The townhouse garden is accessed from the kitchen. It is a quiet oasis with professional landscaping, high privacy fence, and mature trees.

Parlour Floor:
This parlour floor is beyond compare. From the ornate built-in hall tree complete with mirror and bench in the foyer, to the arch-framed bay window in the living room and central gallery with grand staircase, you will be "wowed? at every turn.

The parlour front is occupied by a sitting room that can be used for formal or private occasions by shutting the pocket doors. In addition to the lovely bay window that overlooks the garden, the spacious rear living room has a wall full of bookshelves and a library ladder. The living room is also separated from the gallery by pocket doors. Both rooms have beautiful fireplaces with ornate mantelpieces and patterned tiles surrounding the hearths.

Third Floor:
No modern home is complete without a master bedroom suite, and this townhouse doesn't disappoint. The third floor rear is occupied by a grand bedroom with an arched entryway, exquisite moldings, fireplace, and two large windows that overlook the garden. The bedroom also features a wall of custom floor-to-ceiling closets that is streamlined and wonderfully integrated with historical architectural elements.

Pocket doors provide access to the centralized bathroom from both the front and rear rooms of the master suite. Highlights include two pedestal sinks, a glass-enclosed shower, separate WC, and sparkling white button tiles.

The third floor front is a dedicated home office. It is an energetic and creative space boasting three windows with stained glass transoms, original fireplace, and multiple shelving configurations. The room could easily be used as a bedroom if needed.

Fourth Floor:
The fourth floor hosts two sunny bedroom suites. Both front and rear bedrooms have fireplaces with original wood mantels and marble or brick hearths as well as ample closet space. Each private suite boasts a spacious full bathroom with classic claw-foot bathtubs and pedestal sinks.

Fifth Floor:
Climb up the rear staircase to discover a private family retreat. The fifth floor of the townhouse features a study nook and a comfortable, informal living room, which could also be a fifth bedroom. Each area has a window to take in views of the city skyline, and there is a skylight over the living room for extra sunshine or stargazing. The floor also contains a powder room as well as access points to attic storage and the roof.

PARK LOVERS PARADISE!! There is not enough that can be said about the location of this beautifully newly renovated TRUE one bedroom apartment. While it may be hard to stay indoors while being nestled between both Lincoln Center and Central Park, this apartments completely redone kitchen with brand new appliances, bathroom, and flooring, will make days indoors just as enjoyable. Situated steps from both Central Park and Lincoln Center this apartment is sure to suit the most diverse of location needs and wants. Fordham and Juilliard students enjoy a commute to class of mere blocks, while others, who may be forced to venture further, are within immediate walking distance of both the Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle subway stations. Without a doubt, an absolute must see.

A truly one-of-a-kind townhouse WITH ATTACHED CARRIAGE HOUSE and gorgeous courtyard. Graced with an eclectic collection of premiere finishes and amenities, this 5-bedroom, 6.5-bathroom home is a paragon of urban luxury and design. Features of this 6,047 sq. ft. residence include an elegant limestone facade, gorgeous hardwood floors, a blend of floor-to-ceiling and casement windows on every floor, a convenient laundry room, elevator access on every level, a pair of manicured outdoor spaces, integrated smart home technology, a back-up generator, and an incredibly restored 1,220 sq. ft. coach house complete with its own kitchen, bathrooms, living space, and a clandestine underground entrance.

 Beyond a formal entryway, the garden floor of the home flows into a luminous kitchen and dining area. The dining space is serviced by a wet bar and a powder room, and has easy access to a limestone courtyard fully equipped with a gas grill, a refrigerator, a sink, lighting, and speakers. The Poliform kitchen boasts an eat-in peninsula, sleek countertops, and a suite of high-end stainless steel appliances. The second floor contains a floor-through living and entertaining space as well as an impressive gas fireplace augmented with a remarkable stone surround and a chic light well.

 The third floor is split between a family room, a powder room, and a spacious bedroom with a private closet and full en-suite bathroom. A pair of bedrooms with charming built-ins and pristine en-suite bathrooms occupy the fourth floor, while the fifth floor is dedicated entirely to a tranquil master suite that possesses an entire wall of custom closets and a windowed en-suite with dual vanity sinks, a massive walk-in shower, and a free-standing soaking tub. The rooftop deck has integrated Sonos speakers and commanding views of the surrounding neighborhood.

 The cellar contains a laundry room, a 150-bottle wine room, custom closets, and a passageway that leads to a two-story coach house. The lower level of the coach house features an open-concept Poliform kitchen and dining area that opens into the courtyard, a powder room, and a sky-lit double-height living room with custom closets and a wood-burning fireplace. The upper level contains a huge bedroom with an immense en-suite bathroom.

 Situated in the heart of the Upper East Side, 251 East 61st is just steps away from a number of restaurants, shops, cafes, and bars. It is just two blocks from Bloomingdales and is a short walk to Central Park. Nearby subway lines include the 4/5/6/N/Q/R/W/F. 10,000 sq. ft. of air rights are included.

The illustrious Upper East Side is widely renowned for its high-quality residential living and its world-class cultural institutions. This neighborhood is famous for being safe, family-friendly, green, and beautiful, so it's no wonder that the Upper East Side is easily one of the most charming neighborhoods in Manhattan. Its prestigious history of wealthy residents within close proximity to Central Park has made the number of distinct architectural gems hard to count. The Upper East Side may be a quiet, tranquil place to live, but during the day it is certainly busy - the unrivaled dining and shopping options attract people from all over Manhattan and all over the world. For those looking to experience the finest elements of Manhattan living, the Upper East Side offers just about everything.

 World-renowned architect Bjarke Ingels breakthrough design puts an unconventional twist on the classic Manhattan residential building. Centered around the four core elements: Water, Energy, Air, and Earth VIA 57 WEST redefines green living with an unprecedented vision of sustainability that both respects nature and promotes well-being. The buildings dynamic architecture is reflected throughout the interiors that organically flow from indoor to outdoor living. Materials and construction have been carefully considered and selected for their resilience and environmental impact. Each aspect of the design has been thoughtfully planned to conserve water, reduce energy needs, and promote the wellness of residents while minimizing the impact on the environment.

 VIA 57 WEST offers premium rental residences that balance the excitement of the city and the tranquility of nature. Meeting the discerning needs of each individual, the building offers an array of studio, one, two, three, and four bedroom residences, many with expansive terraces overlooking the Hudson River or VIA Garden a 22,000 square foot lushly planted interior courtyard. A visual gateway to Manhattan, VIA 57 WEST, HELENA 57 WEST and FRANK 57 WEST are part of the 57 WEST residential superblock creating an oasis in one of New Yorks most dynamic cosmopolitan neighborhoods.

Now this is Bushwick!
Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. No longer riding the coattails of its neighbors to the North & West, The Rheingold puts Bushwick on the map with a luxurious, resort style building. Occupying a full square block, on the site of the former Rheingold Brewery, this building features 500 units spread out amongst 8 floors.
The units were designed to maximize your living space and to provide the latest in comfort, design & technology. Large windows and open interiors allow for bright and cheerful layouts. Units are equipped with efficient cooling & heating systems, Built-In Bluetooth speakers and video intercom systems. Finished with wide-plank white oak flooring, designer tiles, high ceilings and ample closet space, the wide variety of floorplans means that there is something for everyone. Most units feature private outdoor space. Kitchens feature stainless steel appliances, soft-close glass cabinetry and sparkling porcelain backsplashes. The bathrooms are outfitted with deep-soaking tubs, sleek chrome fittings, beautiful tiles and medicine cabinets.
With over 70,000 square feet of outdoor space, 41 unique amenities, and a concierge service to handle all your needs, you may never have to leave the building. Work from home? If not, you may be tempted to start! The Rheingold offers a business center, conference rooms, laundry room, creative studios, fitness center and a scrumptious cafeteria. Grab a cup of coffee on your way to work or snack on a croissant as you work from the comfort of your urban oasis. Enjoy four seasons of NY weather in one of the large, landscaped outdoor spaces. Trees, flowers and fountains provide the backdrop on the lower courtyards. Excellent views of NYC, ample lounge space and waterfalls provide the zen factor on the common roofdeck. Test your fear of heights on the rooftop sky-bridge or on the climbing wall in the fitness center. Your four legged friends want to join in the fun? Bring them to the dog run or pet spa. Love to entertain? The building offers many areas that can be reserved for private events or parties including a music studio, photo studio, paint studio, movie screening room and private roof party area.
Home to some of Brooklyn’s best new restaurants, bars and nightlife, Bushwick offers all of the conveniences that NYC has to offer, right at your fingertips. You won’t have to go far for nightly entertainment, Bushwick is home to unrivaled arts, theater and music scenes, many located in former warehouses, a reminder of the neighborhood’s industrial past.
Getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan is a breeze with the variety of convenient transportation options. Ditch those L train blues with the J/M/Z trains just minutes away at the Myrtle Avenue stop. The L train at Morgan Avenue is less than half mile away, the B57 is right around the corner & there is a Citi Bike station just a few blocks away.

Newly Updated 3 Bedroom / 1 Bathroom Apartment in Morningside Heights. Unit boasts an open kitchen with modern appliances and dishwasher. The residential architecture in Morningside Heights is elegant and imposing; the distinct history of Morningside Heights makes it like no place else in New York. Morningside Heights has many charming restaurants and stores, not to mention a lively nightlife, so it is not simply a place for those who are in search of a quiet, historically hallowed area (although it certainly is that too). It marries the Ivy League splendor of Columbia University with the notorious neighborliness of the Upper West Side: delicious dining, magnificent museums, sumptuous sidewalk strolls, exciting cultural centers, and the flanerie-friendly paths of Central Park. It's a quarter of the City where there's always something to do, and always a smile to be had!

A former chocolate factory turned authentic loft community, The Chocolate Factory Lofts boasts expansive, unique layouts, contemporary finishes and rustic industrial charm. Modern finishes blend seamlessly with original factory fixtures such as hardwood flooring, exposed brick walls, reclaimed wood beams and soaring 12' ceilings. In addition, the building also features a stunning roof deck with Manhattan skyline views, a landscaped courtyard, part-time doorman, on-site laundry and garage parking. Located in the historic and artistic Wallabout District of Clinton Hill between Williamsburg and Dumbo, one of Brooklyn's most alluring neighborhoods and just a block from the Brooklyn Navy Yard, The Chocolate Factory boasts retail and business space on site and is surrounded by renowned restaurants, trendy cafes, gourmet grocers and hip boutiques. Transportation options include the Clinton/Washington G train, multiple bus lines to the A,C,F,B and Q trains and a Citi Bike station just outside of the front door. Call today to see these amazing lofts!

Just a block away from dynamic Washington Square this gorgeous and cozy studio apartment is ground floor and street-facing. It is located in a safe and beautiful neighborhood right next to 5th avenue. The crowd in this prime central / west village neighborhood is well-rounded and active around the clock; it consists of young professionals, artists, writers, celebrities, entrepreneurs, and more. 

This location is one of the most coveted in the village area; it contains many historic co-ops and townhouses and is one of the safest locations. This street is quiet as compared to Sixth avenue and has an active and effective block association which has restored much of the aesthetic of the neighborhood (victorian-style street lamps, tree basins, seasonal plantings) and eliminated noise, crime and development in the neighborhood. 
 
Due to these restorations and the beautiful architecture, many call this neighborhood the Gold Coast. The individual historic-designated townhouses, meticulously maintained seasonal plantings and trees, and victorian style surroundings make the Gold Coast the most quaint and enchanting neighborhood in Greenwich Village. 
 
Although Washington Square park is regarded as the heart of the neighborhood there are also many other, smaller parks contributing to the aesthetic: Father Fagan, Minetta Triangle, Petrosino Square, Little Red Square, and Time Landscape. For kids there are also many nearby playgrounds including : Desalvio, Minetta, Thompson Street, Bleecker Street, Downing Street, Mercer Street, Cpl. John A. Seravelli, and William Passannante Ballfield.

The apartment can be furnished or unfurnished for longer leases.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

This doorman elevator building combines a landmark setting with top of the line finishes, unmatched views, and a stellar array of amenities. Each unit is a seamless mix of modern minimalism and historic charm.

The building offers an array of amenities unlike any in the neighborhood. A top of the line gym. A full service laundry room. A co-working space complete with private meeting rooms. A tenants lounge. A huge planted terrace. And a fully furnished roofdeck with 360 views of the entire the Manhattan skyline plus Brooklyn, Queens, and what lies beyond.

Units come equipped with ample living space. Enjoy skyline views throughout many of the apartments and large private terraces overlooking the city. Bathrooms are large and luxurious with rainfall showerheads and exquisitely crafted tilework. Huge windows flood the units with natural light. While touches such as hardwood floors, stone countertops, and crafted moldings give the units a sense of style. Units further come replete with stainless steel appliances, built in dishwashers that match the cabinetwork, and the option to add a washer/dryer in unit.

The Condo, 246 West 17th Street

 Supremely located in the infinitely thriving, always bustling and forever coveted prime Chelsea, 246 West 17th is the epitome of authentic Downtown New York chic, with an abundance of modern charm and effortless luxury living. Completed in West 17thwas transformed into Loft-like Residences offering an ingenious combination of sublime architecture with timeless modern interiors. 246 West 17thbecame an instant star and highly sought- after residential project in the heart of Chelsea and is comprised of a mere 10 floors and only thirty-four residences located at the epicenter of 17th Street and Seventh Avenue. The first three floors were originally constructed in 1925 with seven floors built atop the Prewar brick building creating a unique medley of the historic past and exciting present. There is private underground parking garage in the Condominium, stunning newly redesigned resident lounge and state-of-the art gym, bike storage and private storage available. 246 West 17th is a full service Condominium and is exceptionally intimate and ultra private in the heart of one of Manhattans most engaging neighborhoods --an ever-lasting and coveted residential darling of Chelsea.

 The Offering, Residence no. 3E

 Welcome to Residence no. 3E --- your third floor thoroughly enchanting, exquisitely voluminous and eternally timeless family sized nearly 1500 square foot two bedroom home -- offering a contemporary fully equipped kitchen, two grand bedrooms, two luxuriously appointed bathrooms, one designer powder room and grand 10 foot ceilings facing North. The loft like residence has an enormous living and dining area spanning over 25 feet long paired with the dramatic ceiling heights and a wall of windows, the home exudes an enchanting and ultra chic Chelsea allure and personality while being perfectly pristine and oh-so-grown up. The fabulous open chefs kitchen overlooks the gracious and grand living space, perfect for both intimate and grand family gatherings -- fully equipped with stainless steel appliances -- Miele and SubZero along with Boshe Washer and Dryer. Beyond, lies the master bedroom a serene, glamorous suite with an exquisite windowed master bathroom featuring beautiful double vanity, deep soaking bathtub, separate glass encased shower and radiant heated floors. The second bedroom is sweet and serene with an ensuite bath facing North. There is an abundance of storage throughout the residence, grand and voluminous rooms and three-zone linear diffuser based central air conditioning. 246 West 17th is your future home-sweet-home in the best downtown neighborhood in Manhattan.

The Swannanoa is a 10-story Neo-Renaissance apartment building designed by a prolific designer of residential buildings whose name is generally associated with single-family row houses. The building was originally planned with 40 apartments, four on each floor. Its most imposing feature is the two-story base with granite pilasters and projecting portico supported by four granite columns. Above the portico are seven-story rounded bays, undoubtedly designed to provide residents with views toward nearby Union Square. The brick-faced upper floors are extensively ornamented with Terra- Cotta, including foliate detail, Cartouches, Lion heads, and Dolphins. Designed by Renowned Architect: Gilbert A. Schellinger

Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Amenities include gym, climbing wall, squash courts, yoga room, business center, incredible cinema room, rooms for private parties and gatherings, art and music studios, game rooms, kids playroom/nursery, spa services, sauna and steam room, 24/7 doorman and concierge services in the stunningly gorgeous bi-level lobby.
Indoor garage parking and bicycle storage and laundry facilities onsite.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

Contact Fred to view this or any other apartment in the building.

Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. Now this is Bushwick!

Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. No longer riding the coattails of its neighbors to the North & West, The Rheingold puts Bushwick on the map with a luxurious, resort style building. Occupying a full square block, on the site of the former Rheingold Brewery, this building features 500 units spread out amongst 8 floors.
The units were designed to maximize your living space and to provide the latest in comfort, design & technology. Large windows and open interiors allow for bright and cheerful layouts. Units are equipped with efficient cooling & heating systems, Built-In Bluetooth speakers and video intercom systems. Finished with wide-plank white oak flooring, designer tiles, high ceilings and ample closet space, the wide variety of floorplans means that there is something for everyone. Most units feature private outdoor space. Kitchens feature stainless steel appliances, soft-close glass cabinetry and sparkling porcelain backsplashes. The bathrooms are outfitted with deep-soaking tubs, sleek chrome fittings, beautiful tiles and medicine cabinets.
With over 70,000 square feet of outdoor space, 41 unique amenities, and a concierge service to handle all your needs, you may never have to leave the building. Work from home? If not, you may be tempted to start! The Rheingold offers a business center, conference rooms, laundry room, creative studios, fitness center and a scrumptious cafeteria. Grab a cup of coffee on your way to work or snack on a croissant as you work from the comfort of your urban oasis. Enjoy four seasons of NY weather in one of the large, landscaped outdoor spaces. Trees, flowers and fountains provide the backdrop on the lower courtyards. Excellent views of NYC, ample lounge space and waterfalls provide the zen factor on the common roofdeck. Test your fear of heights on the rooftop sky-bridge or on the climbing wall in the fitness center. Your four legged friends want to join in the fun? Bring them to the dog run or pet spa. Love to entertain? The building offers many areas that can be reserved for private events or parties including a music studio, photo studio, paint studio, movie screening room and private roof party area.
Home to some of Brooklyn’s best new restaurants, bars and nightlife, Bushwick offers all of the conveniences that NYC has to offer, right at your fingertips. You won’t have to go far for nightly entertainment, Bushwick is home to unrivaled arts, theater and music scenes, many located in former warehouses, a reminder of the neighborhood’s industrial past.
Getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan is a breeze with the variety of convenient transportation options. Ditch those L train blues with the J/M/Z trains just minutes away at the Myrtle Avenue stop. The L train at Morgan Avenue is less than half mile away, the B57 is right around the corner & there is a Citi Bike station just a few blocks away.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

A former chocolate factory turned authentic loft community, The Chocolate Factory Lofts boasts expansive, unique layouts, contemporary finishes and rustic industrial charm. Modern finishes blend seamlessly with original factory fixtures such as hardwood flooring, exposed brick walls, reclaimed wood beams and soaring 12' ceilings. In addition, the building also features a stunning roof deck with Manhattan skyline views, a landscaped courtyard, part-time doorman, on-site laundry and garage parking. Located in the historic and artistic Wallabout District of Clinton Hill between Williamsburg and Dumbo, one of Brooklyn's most alluring neighborhoods and just a block from the Brooklyn Navy Yard, The Chocolate Factory boasts retail and business space on site and is surrounded by renowned restaurants, trendy cafes, gourmet grocers and hip boutiques. Transportation options include the Clinton/Washington G train, multiple bus lines to the A,C,F,B and Q trains and a Citi Bike station just outside of the front door. Call today to see these amazing lofts!

Fees required for: Parking, CKO Kickboxing, Wet Lounge

Perched atop the South West corner of McCarren Park rests Ilona. From every angle the building is striking, featuring oversized European casement windows with curved glass accents, intricate masonry work, and raw iron details. The interiors exude class with custom kitchen cabinetry, quartz countertops, ebony oak flooring, as well as subway and penny tiled bathrooms. The homes, offered in studio, one, two, and three bedroom layouts, are all oversized with most afforded Park views and incomparable natural light. The Penthouse collection features 10ft. ceiling heights combined with 9ft. french doors leading to private terraces that overlook McCarren Park and the iconic NYC skyline. Our Town homes offer the best of both worlds, with the discretion of private entrances and backyards, coupled with the amenities of a full service boutique building. Flawless designer details and bright living spaces will take your breath away in this immaculate two-bedroom, two-bathroom penthouse loft in the heart of Greenwich Village/Union Square.

With dramatic arched windows and two massive skylights, this airy 1,800-square-foot, full-floor home is awash in natural light throughout. Swaths of exposed brick and 7-inch wide plank oak flooring add richness and warmth, while ample designer touches appeal to refined, modern sensibilities. Arrive via private key-locked elevator and revel in the great room's 10-foot tall ceilings and substantial footprint for stylish entertaining. Fantastic art walls await your collection, custom iron columns by Steve Morris add historic reverence, and smart built-ins provide special nooks and storage spaces. With premier appliances and a massive reclaimed wood island with seating for eight, the breathtaking kitchen is the literal heart of the home and a luxe gathering place for all. Guests will be entranced by the copper-trimmed skylight and chic custom fixtures, and chefs will love the abundant Luxe/Alvic cabinets, white quartz countertops and bronze tiled backsplash surrounding state-of-the art appliances by Sub-Zero and Bosch. A large dining area provides additional table space, while a gorgeous full bathroom adds convenience.

The home's two spectacular bedrooms are tucked in the tranquil rear of the home. In the exquisite master suite, you'll find another majestic skylight, two oversized walk-in closets and a serene bathroom with radiant heat flooring, dual-sink vanity and frameless glass shower. No detail was overlooked in making this a home of exceeding comfort and convenience. Floors are soundproofed, and windows are double-paned with motorized shades. A massive storage and laundry room includes an in-unit Bosch washer-dryer. Smart home features include mood lighting, built-in Sonos sound system, and a Nest thermostat controlling the dual-zoned HVAC.

Set in prime Greenwich Village/Union Square, midblock between Broadway and University, this fine building is surrounded by great shopping, dining and entertainment at every turn. The famous Strand bookstore is on the next block, NYU is to the south, and gourmet food shopping is a breeze with both Trader Joe's and Whole Foods minutes away. Fitness centers and kids' activities are abundant, and for open space, take your pick from Washington Square Park to the south and Union Square and its phenomenal greenmarket to the north. Access to transportation is unbeatable with 4/5/6, N/Q/R/W, L, F/M and 1/2/3 lines all within reach.

At Highline 537 art, culture and lifestyle blend harmoniously in the epitome of West Chelsea living. Highline 537 is a boutique rental building comprised of custom-designed studio, one and two bedroom residences with condo-quality finishes ? from polished blonde oak flooring, to high end kitchens and bathrooms and in-unit washer/dryers. Layouts are open, windows expansive, rooms sun-filled, ceilings are high, closets are plentiful and air conditioning is central. Other amenities include part-time doorman from Monday through Friday 10am - 7pm, a 24-hour Fitness Room, pre-wiring for Verizon FiOS and Spectrum and a virtual doorman by ButterflyMX. We are a pet-friendly building!

Chelsea is a palette for the senses. Function and beauty intertwine throughout the bohemian streets surrounding Highline 537, from the industrial, farmer-style stalls of Chelsea Market to the gaze-worthy architecture from Frank Gehry, Jean Nouvel, Zaha Hadid and Isay Weinfeld. Art inhabits every corner, prompting a slower gait and handheld cappuccinos at famous stops like Gagosian Gallery, Cheim & Read and Mary Boone. Chelsea takes its flavor profile seriously: the booming neighborhood boasts sweet treats at La Bergamote and Billy's Bakery and savory evenings at critically acclaimed restaurants like Morimoto, Del Posto, Cookshop, and Artichoke Pizza. Here, the night only ends when you want it to. Manhattan's most exclusive nightclubs are housed within Chelsea's streets. Live the portrait on the Highline, New York's lush park in the sky. Use it as your transit to Hudson Yards or down to Meatpacking.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

NO FEE

The Lower East Side was once the world's largest Jewish community, where many immigrants settled and first established the garment industries of New York City. Today it is best known for outstanding shopping bargains along Orchard Street as well as local dining landmarks such as Katz' Deli, open since 1888. This neighborhood also features one of New York City's most prized museums, the Lower East Side Tenement Museum. Neighborhood is bursting with livelihood, surrounded by restaurants and pubs. Concert halls, nightlife, and entertainment guarantee you’ll never be bored.

Come live large in this lower duplex apartment with its generous amount of space in a lovely brownstone and your very own large private backyard garden. This duplex apartment consists of the entire garden and parlor floors and a verdant backyard garden of approximately 700 sq. ft. to roam and ready for the eager green thumbs. Upon entry of the parlor floor, the corridor leads to a large eat-in kitchen complete with dishwasher and a large island that can also double as breakfast bar. Two large windows filter in plenty of natural light highlighting the lofty 11' ceilings of the parlor floor. A cute powder room is conveniently situated at the kitchen corner. The kitchen/dining room combo flows seamlessly to the massive living room with long gallery-like space - perfect backdrop to hang and exhibit some of your fine art collections.  

The garden level with its own entrance consists of the 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, washer and dryer, and access to the basement for storage.  2 bedrooms are larger than king size and the master bedroom comes with an en suite bathroom. The third bedroom fits a queen sized bed and leads out to the backyard garden. All bedrooms come with generous closet space. There's even a corner nook right at the entrance to park your bicycles or baby strollers.  This residence retains plenty of original details reflecting its once opulent and grandeur yesteryears - beautiful carved marble mantle pieces, decorative plaster ceilings, elegant arches and frames, crown and base moldings, and rustic exposed brick walls further add touches of sophistication to the space. This dwelling can be as elegantly understated for a simpler and contemporary feel or easily glammed up worthy of  a designer pad.  Whichever way you'd like, there's simply space to live, rest and play.

Excellent location in North Slope - about 2 blocks from magnificent Grand Army Plaza and beautiful Prospect Park; and half a block from 7th Ave for some of the best in dining, shopping and retails this part of prime Park Slope has to offer. And of course the wonderful Saturday's Green Market at Grand Army Plaza for fresh and organic produce from local farmers. Short walking distance to B,Q,2,3 subway trains and easy 30 minutes commute to Midtown Manhattan.

The Clare, located at the nexus of Midtown and the Upper East Side, provides both elegant shelter from the city and glorious views of the hustle and bustle outside. That duality is the foundation of The Clare’s universal appeal. 

This Studio apartment features walls of floor-to-ceiling windows, heated 7-inch wide white oak flooring, multi-zone heating and cooling systems, LED lighting throughout, and a washer and dryer. The finishes and color palette blend seamlessly with each other and the wide swath of visible sky.

A sleek open kitchen comes equipped with a full range of Miele appliances, framed by custom Poggenpohl cabinetry and quartz-topped counters. A floating island provides the kitchen’s perfect, and practical, centerpiece. 

The bathroom is outfitted with a Carrara Blanco-style marble floor and marble wall tiles by Porcelanosa. A Kohler soaking tub and open shower – with a modesty partition in frosted glass – are serene counterpoints to the extra-large gray quartz countertop with double sink, custom white matte lacquered vanities, generous medicine cabinet, and Watermark features.

The apartment also comes with dishwasher, garbage disposal, and a clothes washer and vent-less dryer.

The Clare's full floor of amenities, perched 13 stories high with 12-foot floor-to-ceiling windows, includes a fitness center and wellness studio; a spacious lounge with a dining room, living room, entertainment center, and pantry, outfitted in walnut and stainless steel; and an 800-square-foot landscaped terrace. 

The views are beyond magnificent, with city views towards Central Park, the Roosevelt Island Tram, the 59th Street Bridge, and Downtown.

The Clare has been brought to life by Manuel Glas Architects, known for their intelligent use of space and innovative, modern compositions. New Yorkers passing by cannot help but be moved by the magnificent light that reflects off a façade of panels by Porcelanosa, natural Indian limestone, and glass.

Pets under 40 pounds are welcome with 1 month of additional security deposit required

The deep hue of wide-plank solid-oak floors, in combination with bright white walls, recessed lighting, and a sleek, custom-designed kitchen, define the dynamic, contemporary feel of the living space, which is open and expansive- in the very best tradition of the classic Tribeca loft. The master bedroom features a walk-through closet that opens onto the master bath. The residences are filled with light. They boast high ceilings and tall windows. 66 Rockwell offers luxury in house valet service for the Residence. Wash & Fold, Dry Cleaning and packages right to your door and delivered into your home if you prefer. Services available also include, expert tailoring, same day pressing, organic dry cleaning and housekeeping.

Lifestyle:
* Sky Lounge: 
When you are ready to unwind, Rockwell offers the exclusive EOS Club. Members enjoy access to the Sky Lounge and Sky Deck showcasing a panoramic view of Downtown Brooklyn, the East River and the Manhattan Skyline. Indulge in the ambiance as the lounge music sets the mood against the glow of the two-way fireplace. After the sun sets the lounge becomes even more irresistible as the unique LED ceiling begins to come to life in color bringing the NY evening to life. 

* EOS Fit:
The EOS Gym features weekly classes which include, Yoga, Dance Fitness, Full Body Conditioning, Stretch and Core Strengthening and More, all from The Mark Morris Dance Group. In addition, Kickboxing classes are held by instructors from Brooklyn Martial Arts.

* EOS Play:
The game room offers a pool and an air hockey table, foosball tables and an Arcade room with classic video games all set to free play. 

* Zen Garden:
Members have access to large size BBQ grills, a dining table, ping pong tables and plenty of patio furniture which make this area feel like your suburban backyard. A large screening wall has been host to our popular summer movie nights. 

* EOS Community:
Only at Rockwell will you experience a social interactive community. EOS club events included events such as, Game Night and Entertainment, cooking classes, mixology, wellness events, happy hours, movie screenings and much more. 

* EOS Coffee Kiosk:
The coffee shop located in the EOS Lounge serves delicious coffees, espressos and teas from The Brooklyn Roasting Company. Text your order and our trained baristas will have your beverage of choice ready when you arrive. Members also have access to the clubs' bike share located right in front of Rockwell, reserved only for EOS members. The book club, sponsored by the beloved neighborhood Greenlight Book Store, welcomes new members.

A former chocolate factory turned authentic loft community, The Chocolate Factory Lofts boasts expansive, unique layouts, contemporary finishes and rustic industrial charm. Modern finishes blend seamlessly with original factory fixtures such as hardwood flooring, exposed brick walls, reclaimed wood beams and soaring 12' ceilings. In addition, the building also features a stunning roof deck with Manhattan skyline views, a landscaped courtyard, part-time doorman, on-site laundry and garage parking. Located in the historic and artistic Wallabout District of Clinton Hill between Williamsburg and Dumbo, one of Brooklyn's most alluring neighborhoods and just a block from the Brooklyn Navy Yard, The Chocolate Factory boasts retail and business space on site and is surrounded by renowned restaurants, trendy cafes, gourmet grocers and hip boutiques. Transportation options include the Clinton/Washington G train, multiple bus lines to the A,C,F,B and Q trains and a Citi Bike station just outside of the front door. Call today to see these amazing lofts!

Fees required for: Parking, CKO Kickboxing, Wet Lounge

The Griswold is a Cooperative apartment building which was erected in 1937 and has retained all of its Neo-classic style and beauty. The 84 units are home to a culturally and ethnically diverse community, that values the many things that make The Griswold and Jackson Heights unique.  Many of the units are also home to feline and canine companions. Residents celebrate life at The Griswold by gathering for social gatherings, BBQ's, holiday parties and other resident events.  The Griswold is a unique community with friendly and considerate neighbors, a diligent Board of Directors and a highly responsible Management company. Welcome to your new home!

Located in the well-sought neighborhood of Greenpoint, this two-bedroom/two-bathroom home offers South and West exposures. Featuring premium finishes and quality craftsmanship, this residence offers 7-inch brushed-and-stained white oak flooring, brushed aluminum hardware and energy-efficient windows. This home is independently heated and cooled for individual climate control, including exceptional sound insulation for additional privacy and energy efficiency. The custom designed kitchen features precision milled oak cabinetry with concealed pulls and a statuary marble slab countertop. Top-tier appliances include a Viking cooktop and oven, a Liebherr refrigerator and a paneled Bosch dishwasher. The bathrooms have an inspired medley of stone and tile, along with innovative details like a recessed shower curtain track and full-height, mirrored medicine cabinet, complement beauty with added functionality. The custom built vanity evokes fine furniture. The inset medicine cabinet is illuminated by integrated lighting, all complemented with Hansgrohe polished chrome hardware. A must-see!
